f2ff81b2-f594-4e91-a5e8-df51e69ebb48.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in fundraising to achieve $2,500 or more as a participating "Soakee" in the ALS Association's CEO Soak event. Through challenging their peers, networking in their community, or boosting employee morale, these Soakees competed to get soaked once again for ALS.
f2ff81b2-f594-4e91-a5e8-df51e69ebb48.name: CEO Soak -2022- Soakee

badge_template_activities.title: Raised at least $2,500.
Participated as a "Soakee" at a CEO Soak event.

4fc00c0e-5434-44db-a234-116aca00ee98.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in serving as a CEO Soak Committee Member in 2022 through achieving the following: commitment to serve in this role for the event year and attend meetings, introduction of contacts for recruitment and sponsorship for pipeline of new revenue, achievement of fundraising goals, recruitment of additional committee members, and offering innovative ideas for event improvement.
4fc00c0e-5434-44db-a234-116aca00ee98.name: CEO Soak -2022- Committee Member

badge_template_activities.title: Introducing and sharing contacts for recruitment and sponsorship within circle of influence for pipeline of new recruitment.
Offering feedback and innovative ideas for event improvement and diversity, equity and inclusion efforts.
Recruiting additional committee members for support

7cb61596-2158-4b62-853c-963df3e0b77d.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in fundraising to achieve $5,000 or more as a participating "Team" in the ALS Association's CEO Soak event. Through challenging their peers, networking in their community, or boosting employee morale, these Teams have competed to get soaked once again for ALS.
7cb61596-2158-4b62-853c-963df3e0b77d.name: CEO Soak -2022- Top Team

badge_template_activities.title: Raised at least $5,000 for a CEO Soak Event.

1d13b5aa-b0e0-4861-8bc5-ba4573ef375b.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in year-round planning with an emphasis on early recruitment of volunteer leadership and team development. Their Walk to Defeat ALS event demonstrated achievement through at least 3 out of 7 Execution of Best Practices categories which include team development, cultivation and pipeline development, communication plan, collaboration and training, stewardship, mission and research, corporate recruitment
1d13b5aa-b0e0-4861-8bc5-ba4573ef375b.name: Pacesetter -2022-

badge_template_activities.title: TEAM DEVELOPMENT may include: Specific strategies to retain and acquire new teams, a community wheel/mapping assessment with assignment of individuals to target opportunity areas, care services staff engagement in outreach/corporate lead generation, and targeted support group attendance/collaboration.
CULTIVATION & PIPELINE DEVELOPMENT: Developing and executing a cultivation plan for current and past VIP individuals focused on introductions to other areas of the organization.
COMMUNICATION PLAN: Creating and implementing multi-channel communications leading into/out of event including phone, email, mail, social, Hustle, video.

COLLABORATION & TRAINING may include: Regularly attending regional meetings, partner with national staff during trainings, partner with care services staff in recruitment/retention, schedule outreach and presentations with stewardship chair, attending development, mission and advocacy trainings offered.

STEWARDSHIP may include: Implementing a minimum of two new pre-event activities, completed 3 months prior to event focused on promotion/recruitment, quarterly personalized outreach to Top 10 teams, quarterly personalized outreach to Top 20 participants, implementation of Key to Defeat Program.
MISSION & RESEARCH CALL TO ACTION: Incorporating interactive table/area/activities focused on Research or preparing an updated Case for Support.

CORPORATE RECRUITMENT may include: Hosting corporate kick-off/breakfast/lunch & learn, rally/informational event on recruitment strategy, community festival/corporate health/job fair with 100+ people, quarterly personalized outreach to sponsors.

52b63dc9-d088-44d9-8693-85cebed0d3d3.description: Earners have mastered incorporation of all core elements of the Walk to Defeat ALS program and strive to raise the bar to strengthen their event through advanced planning, collaboration and communication strategies.
52b63dc9-d088-44d9-8693-85cebed0d3d3.name: Pacesetter Platinum -2022-

badge_template_activities.title: Exceed or meet event income goal
TEAM RETENTION may include: 80% of previous year VIP Teams register and fundraise in Classy/Luminate, PALS engagement increases by 2%, or development staff attend outreach/engagement

COMMITTEE DEVELOPMENT & PARTNERSHIP may include: Recruiting event leader and completing eLearning Onboarding, increasing event committee membership by 20%, establishing succession planning pipeline through recruitment of incoming event lead, committee securing corporate team/partnership totaling $5,000+

ACQUISITION may include: Acquiring a new regional or national corporate partnership, acquiring a new regional or national corporate team, acquiring a multi-year partnership of $10,000+ within local chapter network, successfully transitioning VIP event donor or team captain into sustainer/major donor of $10,000+

INNOVATION: Implement at least one new strategy from the following areas with demonstrable impact: memorial activities, team captain motivation, competitive fundraising promotions/incentives, Unlock program, corporate engagement, Team Remember

94562779-82e0-4992-ad0f-252fcd59d6e2.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated excellence in year-round planning with an emphasis on early recruitment of volunteer leadership and team development. Their Walk to Defeat ALS event demonstrated achievement through at least 5 out of 7 Execution of Best Practices categories which include team development, cultivation and pipeline development, communication plan, collaboration and training, stewardship, mission and research, corporate recruitment
94562779-82e0-4992-ad0f-252fcd59d6e2.name: Pacesetter Plus -2022-

CULTIVATION & PIPELINE DEVELOPMENT: Developing and executing a cultivation plan for current and past VIP individuals focused on introductions to other areas of the organization.
COMMUNICATION PLAN: Creating and implementing multi-channel communications leading into/out of event including phone, email, mail, social, Hustle, video.

COLLABORATION AND TRAINING may include: Regularly attending regional meetings, partner with national staff during trainings, partnering with care services staff in recruitment/retention, scheduling outreach and presentations with stewardship chair, attending development, mission and advocacy trainings offered.

STEWARDSHIP may include: Implementing a minimum of two new pre-event activities, completing 3 months prior to event focused on promotion/recruitment, quarterly personalized outreach to Top 10 teams, quarterly personalized outreach to Top 20 participants, implementation of Key to Defeat Program.
MISSION & RESEARCH CALL TO ACTION: Incorporating interactive table/area/activities focused on Research, preparing an updated Case for Support.

CORPORATE RECRUITMENT may include: Hosting corporate kick-off/breakfast/lunch & learn, rally/informational event on recruitment strategy, community festival/corporate health/job fair with 100+ people, quarterly personalized outreach to sponsors.
